Excellent game that exercises your brain well. It's a good break from typical FPS games. Great Dialogue throughout the entire game.
This game is one of the best I have ever played! I highly recomend it :)

This is a short, fun game that is fun to screw with, and challenge you're self with. A great game with a legacy that will live on. I also strongly recommend Portal 2, for even more great story line and challenges. The cake is a lie 9/10

FPSのパズルゲームとしてはかなり高い評価をうけている作品です。
時々無料で配布されていることもありますので機会をみるのもありです。
2つのポータルが作れるようになるまではチュートリアルなステージになります。
パズルとしての後半ステージがメインになりますが難解ではないので攻略には問題ないレベルです。
でも、GLaDOSとの最終戦は何をしていいかよくわからず何回もやり直しました。
実績はカメラ、ラジオは結構面倒ですがこれはきっちりやっていくだけなので問題ありません。
でも、ポータルチャレンジの歩数、タイムはかなり面倒です。
腕がないのもあってプレイ時間の2/3はこの実績チャレンジに使った時間となります。
実績が完了した記念に書いてみました。
круто
This game...is really good.  Really, really good.

Absolutely brilliant and origional first person "shooter". My sole complaint is that it's just too damn short as I've managed to complete it in under two hours on several occasions. You'd think a puzzle game like this wouldn't have much reply value once you figure out how to solve each level, but as many of the levels are also trials in agility and reaction, it never gets old.
Best puzzle game I have ever played IMO.
Portal is a first person puzzle game that is short but very unique and a blast to play.
its fucking portal... 9.6/10
How it all began. No excuse good enough not to play it.
Мне, конечно, игра очень понравилась, но я так и не нашёл тот глупый торт. >_<

There's a reason this game got a sequel. It's one of those games where thinking outside of the box (and with portals) is truly rewarding. It will make you think at many different points, and it only ever REALLY challenges your cognitive thinking if you want to let it: none of the main story challenges are absurdly difficult. Plus, there's cake. SERIOUSLY. IT'S NOT A LIE. 
Mind you, the game is a tad short. Like, maybe an hour to 90 minutes for the main game.
But yeah. If you're one of those guys who enjoys a puzzle/ 3-D platforming game, then you'll love this game.
Супер!!! =)
Πολύ πρωτότυπο και εθιστικό.
great game

Como suele ser en Valve, otro mod que termina en un juego impresionante.

Una aventura en primera persona muy revolucionaria, diferente, un soplo de aire fresco que como punto negativo, podemos decir que es muy corto al estrar pensado en poder pasarse de una sentada.

No tiene desperdicio, os animo a probarlo si os van los puzzles con argumento y transfondo currado.
Finished this game on the 360 years ago, a must-play for every gamer.
Worlds best and most fun puzzle game. Also the father of the best selling game Portal 2. Have to get to know the full story of Chell.
If i had a portal gun i would shoot two walls in my shower and wash that one spot on my back that i cant get to without destroying my shoulder.
First they came up with a new game mechanic, then with a fun narrative. Classic.
Super jeu mais un peu court !

I was late to the table when I discovered this game. But I'm glad I did find this game as the gameplay is addictive and you'll fall in love with GlaDOS, the crazy sentient computer who is trying to kill you.

The idea behind Portal is simple. Using a portal gun that is able to create two portals you have to escape a myriad of trap laden rooms. It's brilliant! All in all Portal is a brainbuster that makes you think your routes out very carefully.

I'd recommend anybody who has a sense of humor and who doesn't mind the puzzles to try out this game.
It's Portal! What more do you need to know? If you haven't yet played it, play it.
The atmosphere of the universe perfectly complements this game.
If you love puzzles, you will love this. And if you don't, you will love it too.
Every game I've played since Portal has failed to match up to it. It's amazing.
Un juego de un solo jugador que me hablaron muy bien y lo confirmo. Aunque no se si se podran añadir más capitulos ya que el juego se hace muy corto en las pantallas faciles

Damn good puzzle game. One of the few FPS Games where shooting it with a shotgun doesn't solve it. There aren't weapons, for starters. COD fans don't like it becuse they need to think with portals insted of thier gun.

I love puzzles, even when they frustrate me. Sometimes I have a little difficulty figuring out how to solve something, but I don't mind it. It makes your brain think. I was thoroughly entertained by this game. (Play the sequel!)
Don't bother playing this one. Just skip to Portal 2, you don't need this game to understand any backstory of what is going on.
This is the reason I became a gamer. it's a great introductory title, so tell your friends!
I love Portal, but everytime I hear some unoriginal bandwagon airhead utter the phrase "the cake is a lie lol," I die a little inside.
apparently android hell is not level 16

No es un gran juego, la historia es algo floja, creo que lo mas novedoso y es por eso que lo catalogan como buen juego son los portales, es interesante ver como vas pasando las etapas e ideando estrategias para pasar. Es corto, aprox. 3 horas en terminarlo. Para los que son fanáticos de estos juegos se los recomiendo pero si no, mejor jugar el 2.

Si ya estás cansado del típico FPS de disparos... ¡No puedes permitirte el lujo de no tener este juego! Portal te llevará al corazón de los Laboratorios de Investigación y Desarrollo de Aperture Science para manejar la pistola de portales y superar las diferentes cámaras de pruebas que no son otra cosa que una serie de puzzles. Si el ser Chell en esta aventura se te ha hecho corto y lo que necesitas son más pruebas porque ya has superado todos los retos y cámaras avanzadas... ¡No dejes de probar el mod Portal: Prelude para meterte en la piel de Abby con cámaras mucho más complicadas o sigue tu aventura unos "cuantos años más tarde" en los mismos laboratorios de nuevo de la mano de Chell y tu nuevo compañero Weathley! Portal 2 es mucho más largo que Portal ya que este, quizás la primera vez cueste y se haga largo (como todo) pero cuando ya te lo sepas de memoria o "píxel por píxel" verás que en una hora como mucho ya te lo has pasado completamente.
Favorite game series of all time. Hands down, no contest.
